class.name: ContentControl
class.description: Represents a content control. Content controls are bounded and potentially labeled regions in a document that serve as containers for specific types of content. Individual content controls may contain contents such as images, tables, or paragraphs of formatted text. Currently, only rich text, plain text, checkbox, dropdown list, and combo box content controls are supported.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

properties.name: appearance
properties.description: Specifies the appearance of the content control. The value can be 'BoundingBox', 'Tags', or 'Hidden'.

properties.name: buildingBlockGalleryContentControl
properties.description: Gets the building block gallery-related data if the content control's Word.ContentControlType is BuildingBlockGallery. It's null otherwise.

properties.name: cannotDelete
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the user can delete the content control. Mutually exclusive with removeWhenEdited.

properties.name: cannotEdit
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the user can edit the contents of the content control.

properties.name: checkboxContentControl
properties.description: Gets the data of the content control when its type is CheckBox. It's null otherwise.

examples.description: Toggles the isChecked property of the first checkbox content control found in the selection.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the color of the content control. Color is specified in '#RRGGBB' format or by using the color name.

properties.name: comboBoxContentControl
properties.description: Gets the data of the content control when its type is ComboBox. It's null otherwise.

examples.description: Adds the provided list item to the first combo box content control in the selection.

properties.name: contentControls
properties.description: Gets the collection of content control objects in the content control.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: datePickerContentControl
properties.description: Gets the date picker-related data if the content control's Word.ContentControlType is DatePicker. It's null otherwise.

properties.name: dropDownListContentControl
properties.description: Gets the data of the content control when its type is DropDownList. It's null otherwise.

examples.description: Adds the provided list item to the first dropdown list content control in the selection.

properties.name: endnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of endnotes in the content control.

properties.name: fields
properties.description: Gets the collection of field objects in the content control.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Gets the text format of the content control. Use this to get and set font name, size, color, and other properties.

properties.name: footnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of footnotes in the content control.

properties.name: groupContentControl
properties.description: Gets the group-related data if the content control's Word.ContentControlType is Group. It's null otherwise.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Gets an integer that represents the content control identifier.

properties.name: inlinePictures
properties.description: Gets the collection of InlinePicture objects in the content control. The collection doesn't include floating images.

properties.name: lists
properties.description: Gets the collection of list objects in the content control.

properties.name: paragraphs
properties.description: Gets the collection of paragraph objects in the content control.

properties.name: parentBody
properties.description: Gets the parent body of the content control.

properties.name: parentContentControl
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the content control. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.

properties.name: parentContentControlOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the content control. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

properties.name: parentTable
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the content control. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table.

properties.name: parentTableCell
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the content control. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table cell.

properties.name: parentTableCellOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the content control. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

properties.name: parentTableOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the content control. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

properties.name: pictureContentControl
properties.description: Gets the picture-related data if the content control's Word.ContentControlType is Picture. It's null otherwise.

properties.name: placeholderText
properties.description: Specifies the placeholder text of the content control. Dimmed text will be displayed when the content control is empty.

properties.name: removeWhenEdited
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the content control is removed after it is edited. Mutually exclusive with cannotDelete.

properties.name: repeatingSectionContentControl
properties.description: Gets the repeating section-related data if the content control's Word.ContentControlType is RepeatingSection. It's null otherwise.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Specifies the style name for the content control. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the "styleBuiltIn" property.

properties.name: styleBuiltIn
properties.description: Specifies the built-in style name for the content control. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the "style" property.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Gets the content control subtype. The subtype can be 'RichTextInline', 'RichTextParagraphs', 'RichTextTableCell', 'RichTextTableRow' and 'RichTextTable' for rich text content controls, or 'PlainTextInline' and 'PlainTextParagraph' for plain text content controls, or 'CheckBox' for checkbox content controls.

properties.name: tables
properties.description: Gets the collection of table objects in the content control.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: Specifies a tag to identify a content control.

examples.description: Traverses each paragraph of the document and wraps a content control on each with either a even or odd tags.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Gets the text of the content control.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Specifies the title for a content control.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Gets the content control type. Only rich text, plain text, and checkbox content controls are supported currently.

properties.name: xmlMapping
properties.description: Returns an XmlMapping object that represents the mapping of the content control to XML data in the data store of the document.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the contents of the content control. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the content control and its content. If keepContent is set to true, the content isn't deleted.

params.name: keepContent
params.description: Required. Indicates whether the content should be deleted with the content control. If keepContent is set to true, the content isn't deleted.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: getComments
methods.description: Gets comments associated with the content control.

methods.name: getContentControls
methods.description: Gets the currently supported child content controls in this content control.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Options that define which content controls are returned.

methods.name: getHtml
methods.description: Gets an HTML representation of the content control object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for of the formatting of the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use `ContentControl.getOoxml()` and convert the returned XML to HTML.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: getOoxml
methods.description: Gets the Office Open XML (OOXML) representation of the content control object.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Gets the whole content control, or the starting or ending point of the content control, as a range.

params.name: rangeLocation
params.description: Optional. The range location must be 'Whole', 'Start', 'End', 'Before', 'After', or 'Content'.

methods.name: getReviewedText
methods.description: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.

params.name: changeTrackingVersion
params.description: Optional. The value must be 'Original' or 'Current'. The default is 'Current'.

params.name: changeTrackingVersion
params.description: Optional. The value must be 'Original' or 'Current'. The default is 'Current'.

methods.name: getTextRanges
methods.description: Gets the text ranges in the content control by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks.

params.name: endingMarks
params.description: Required. The punctuation marks and/or other ending marks as an array of strings.

params.name: trimSpacing
params.description: Optional. Indicates whether to trim spacing characters (spaces, tabs, column breaks, and paragraph end marks) from the start and end of the ranges returned in the range collection. Default is false which indicates that spacing characters at the start and end of the ranges are included in the range collection.

methods.name: getTrackedChanges
methods.description: Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the content control.

methods.name: insertBreak
methods.description: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document. This method cannot be used with 'RichTextTable', 'RichTextTableRow' and 'RichTextTableCell' content controls.

params.name: breakType
params.description: Required. Type of break.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Start', 'End', 'Before', or 'After'.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: insertFileFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a document into the content control at the specified location.

params.name: base64File
params.description: Required. The Base64-encoded content of a .docx file.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Replace', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Replace' cannot be used with 'RichTextTable' and 'RichTextTableRow' content controls.

methods.name: insertHtml
methods.description: Inserts HTML into the content control at the specified location.

params.name: html
params.description: Required. The HTML to be inserted in to the content control.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Replace', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Replace' cannot be used with 'RichTextTable' and 'RichTextTableRow' content controls.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: insertInlinePictureFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts an inline picture into the content control at the specified location.

params.name: base64EncodedImage
params.description: Required. The Base64-encoded image to be inserted in the content control.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Replace', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Replace' cannot be used with 'RichTextTable' and 'RichTextTableRow' content controls.

methods.name: insertOoxml
methods.description: Inserts OOXML into the content control at the specified location.

params.name: ooxml
params.description: Required. The OOXML to be inserted in to the content control.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Replace', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Replace' cannot be used with 'RichTextTable' and 'RichTextTableRow' content controls.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.

params.name: paragraphText
params.description: Required. The paragraph text to be inserted.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Start', 'End', 'Before', or 'After'. 'Before' and 'After' cannot be used with 'RichTextTable', 'RichTextTableRow' and 'RichTextTableCell' content controls.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: insertTable
methods.description: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns into, or next to, a content control.

params.name: rowCount
params.description: Required. The number of rows in the table.

params.name: columnCount
params.description: Required. The number of columns in the table.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Start', 'End', 'Before', or 'After'. 'Before' and 'After' cannot be used with 'RichTextTable', 'RichTextTableRow' and 'RichTextTableCell' content controls.

params.name: values
params.description: Optional 2D array. Cells are filled if the corresponding strings are specified in the array.

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts text into the content control at the specified location.

params.name: text
params.description: Required. The text to be inserted in to the content control.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: Required. The value must be 'Replace', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Replace' cannot be used with 'RichTextTable' and 'RichTextTableRow' content controls.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load all of the content control properties

methods.name: resetState
methods.description: Resets the state of the content control.

methods.name: search
methods.description: Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the content control object. The search results are a collection of range objects.

params.name: searchText
params.description: Required. The search text.

params.name: searchOptions
params.type: Word.SearchOptions | { ignorePunct?: boolean; ignoreSpace?: boolean; matchCase?: boolean; matchPrefix?: boolean; matchSuffix?: boolean; matchWholeWord?: boolean; matchWildcards?: boolean; }
params.description: Optional. Options for the search.

examples.description: Run a batch operation against the Word object model.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects the content control. This causes Word to scroll to the selection.

params.name: selectionMode
params.description: Optional. The selection mode must be 'Select', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Select' is the default.

params.name: selectionMode
params.description: Optional. The selection mode must be 'Select', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Select' is the default.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: setState
methods.description: Sets the state of the content control.

params.name: contentControlState
params.description: State to be set.

params.name: contentControlState
params.description: State to be set.

methods.name: split
methods.description: Splits the content control into child ranges by using delimiters.

params.name: delimiters
params.description: Required. The delimiters as an array of strings.

params.name: multiParagraphs
params.description: Optional. Indicates whether a returned child range can cover multiple paragraphs. Default is false which indicates that the paragraph boundaries are also used as delimiters.

params.name: trimDelimiters
params.description: Optional. Indicates whether to trim delimiters from the ranges in the range collection. Default is false which indicates that the delimiters are included in the ranges returned in the range collection.

params.name: trimSpacing
params.description: Optional. Indicates whether to trim spacing characters (spaces, tabs, column breaks, and paragraph end marks) from the start and end of the ranges returned in the range collection. Default is false which indicates that spacing characters at the start and end of the ranges are included in the range collection.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.ContentControl` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.ContentControlData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.
